TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ICharacterData implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Org.W3c.Dom.INode, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The CharacterData interface extends Node with a set of attributes and methods for accessing character data in the DOM.

remarks.para: The CharacterData interface extends Node with a set of attributes and methods for accessing character data in the DOM. For clarity this set is defined here rather than on each object that uses these attributes and methods. No DOM objects correspond directly to CharacterData, though Text and others do inherit the interface from it. All offsets in this interface start from 0.

As explained in the DOMString interface, text strings in the DOM are represented in UTF-16, i.e. as a sequence of 16-bit units. In the following, the term 16-bit units is used whenever necessary to indicate that indexing on CharacterData is done in 16-bit units.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AppendData(string arg) cil managed

Docs.summary: Append the string to the end of the character data of the node.

remarks.para: Append the string to the end of the character data of the node. Upon success, data provides access to the concatenation of data and the DOMString specified.

Docs.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

set: Android.Runtime.Register("setData", "(Ljava/lang/String;)V", "GetSetData_Ljava_lang_String_Handler:Org.W3c.Dom.ICharacterDataInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: The character data of the node that implements this interface.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
The character data of the node that implements this interface. The DOM implementation may not put arbitrary limits on the amount of data that may be stored in a CharacterData node. However, implementation limits may mean that the entirety of a node's data may not fit into a single DOMString. In such cases, the user may call substringData to retrieve the data in appropriately sized pieces.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
The character data of the node that implements this interface. The DOM implementation may not put arbitrary limits on the amount of data that may be stored in a CharacterData node. However, implementation limits may mean that the entirety of a node's data may not fit into a single DOMString. In such cases, the user may call substringData to retrieve the data in appropriately sized pieces.

Docs.exception: DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR: Raised when it would return more characters than fit in a DOMString variable on the implementation platform.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised when the node is readonly.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteData (int offset, int count);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DeleteData(int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: The offset from which to start removing.
The number of 16-bit units to delete. If the sum of offset and count exceeds length then all 16-bit units from offset to the end of the data are deleted.
Docs.summary: Remove a range of 16-bit units from the node.

remarks.para: Remove a range of 16-bit units from the node. Upon success, data and length reflect the change.

Docs.exception:
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified offset is negative or greater than the number of 16-bit units in data, or if the specified count is negative.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

Docs.exception:

NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("getLength", "()I", "GetGetLengthHandler:Org.W3c.Dom.ICharacterDataInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: The number of 16-bit units that are available through data and the substringData method below.

remarks.para: The number of 16-bit units that are available through data and the substringData method below. This may have the value zero, i.e., CharacterData nodes may be empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ReplaceData (int offset, int count, string arg);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReplaceData(int32 offset, int32 count, string arg) cil managed

Docs.param: The offset from which to start replacing.

The number of 16-bit units to replace. If the sum of offset and count exceeds length, then all 16-bit units to the end of the data are replaced; (i.e., the effect is the same as a remove method call with the same range, followed by an append method invocation).
The DOMString with which the range must be replaced.
Docs.summary: Replace the characters starting at the specified 16-bit unit offset with the specified string.

remarks.para: Replace the characters starting at the specified 16-bit unit offset with the specified string.

Docs.exception:
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified offset is negative or greater than the number of 16-bit units in data, or if the specified count is negative.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

MemberSignature.Value: public string SubstringData (int offset, int count);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string SubstringData(int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: Start offset of substring to extract.
The number of 16-bit units to extract.
Docs.summary: Extracts a range of data from the node.

remarks.para: Extracts a range of data from the node.

Docs.exception:
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified offset is negative or greater than the number of 16-bit units in data, or if the specified count is negative.
DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified range of text does not fit into a DOMString.
